definition: to arrange food on a plate/to plate up/food presentation/(watchmaking) balance wheel
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: Tie up the long carrot slice on the cabbage roll as ribbon. Serve with dipping sauce.
sentences.chinese: 系上胡萝卜丝即可配合沾酱摆盘上桌。

sentences.english: In the menu the it was pictured as carved in a flower shape.
sentences.chinese: 在菜单上的照片里，摆盘是一朵花。

sentences.english: Continue to shape the remaining breadsticks while the first batch is baking.
sentences.chinese: 当第一盘在烘烤时继续摆盘剩下的面包棒。

definition: to smell, look and taste great
dish (food prepared according to a specific recipe)
pasta (abbr. for 意大利麵|意大利面[Yi4 da4 li4 mian4])/(Tw) yi mein, a variety of Cantonese egg noodle
ingredients (in a cooking recipe)/to mix materials according to directions
